title: Institutional documentation: Treasury & Monetary Policy page + React Query provider fix

requirements.summary: Add a new institutional documentation page titled "Treasury & Monetary Policy" with existing luxury black/gold styling, written in a neutral, conceptual/non-operational tone with an explicit disclaimer and no backend interactions.
acceptanceCriteria: A new route exists for the Treasury & Monetary Policy page and it renders without errors
The page content includes an explicit disclaimer that it is conceptual/non-operational and does not execute transactions, token issuance, swaps, bridges, or financial operations
No backend calls or canister methods are invoked by this page

file_operations.description: Create the new "Treasury & Monetary Policy" institutional documentation page using the existing luxury black/gold styling patterns (layout sections, glass-card styling, typography) and include a prominent explicit disclaimer that the content is conceptual/non-operational (no transactions, token issuance, swaps/bridges, or any financial execution), with strictly static rendering (no React Query, no actor hooks, no network calls).
Register a new TanStack Router route for the "Treasury & Monetary Policy" page and wire it into the route tree so it is navigable and renders within the existing Layout.

requirements.summary: Add header navigation access to the new "Treasury & Monetary Policy" page for desktop and mobile, following existing TanStack Router link patterns and bilingual (PT/EN) behavior with English support.
acceptanceCriteria: Header navigation shows a working link to the new page on desktop and in the mobile sheet menu
When language is set to English, the nav label and page headings are shown in English

file_operations.description: Add new bilingual nav label translation keys for the "Treasury & Monetary Policy" page (PT/EN) so the header can render the correct label under the existing language behavior, ensuring an English label is available.

Add a new navigation item (desktop and mobile sheet) linking to the "Treasury & Monetary Policy" route, using the existing TanStack Router <Link> patterns and LanguageContext translation keys to support PT/EN behavior with English text available.

Ensure the page headings and user-facing labels are sourced from the existing language state (PT/EN) and include English headings when language is set to English, while keeping the page documentation-only and non-interactive.

requirements.summary: Keep DAO/governance documentation explicitly conceptual and isolated from gameplay by avoiding shared interactive flows, shared state, or backend-backed execution connections between governance docs and the game layer.
acceptanceCriteria: No new backend endpoints are added for DAO/governance execution, token operations, treasury operations, swapping, bridging, or payments as part of this change
Gameplay-related routes and existing game backend features continue to function as before

file_operations.description: Revise DAO/governance page copy to be explicitly conceptual/non-operational (no execution language, no transactional or token-operation implications) and add/strengthen a visible disclaimer stating it is documentation-only and does not connect to gameplay flows or execute any treasury/token/swap/bridge actions.

Tighten DAO/governance and related treasury narrative phrasing where needed to reinforce documentation-only conceptual intent (no operational promises or execution framing) and ensure no governance content introduces shared interactive flows/state with gameplay (keep sections informational and static).

Ensure the new treasury/monetary policy documentation page remains fully isolated from gameplay features by remaining static, avoiding shared state hooks used by game features, and containing a clear statement that it does not integrate with or trigger gameplay capabilities.

requirements.summary: Remove the nested/duplicate React Query QueryClientProvider so only one QueryClientProvider exists at runtime, without modifying immutable files (including frontend/src/main.tsx).
acceptanceCriteria: The app renders with a single React Query QueryClientProvider in the component tree
React Query caching/invalidation continues to work (no runtime errors; existing queries still resolve)

file_operations.description: Remove the QueryClientProvider wrapper and local QueryClient instance from App so that the single QueryClientProvider defined in the immutable frontend/src/main.tsx is the only provider in the runtime tree; keep routing, theming, and Toaster rendering intact.
